roleset.name: be cognizant of, realize
roleset.note: KNOW-V NOTES: Based on big corpus, comparison with 'say' and 'think'. Adjectival 'known' by Julia based on BOLT-6.(from know.01-v)
KNOWLEDGEABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, know-v.01. (from knowledgeable.01-j)
The frame file for this verb has been restructured by Claire. March 2015.

role.descr: entity that arg1 is known ABOUT

example.name: know-v: just transitive
example.text: I-1 need *trace*-1 to know the aircraft and flight number.

example.name: know-v: sentential thing known
example.text: The other side knows that Giuliani has always been prochoice.
example.arg: that Guiliani has always been prochoice

example.name: know-v: attributive
example.text: He didn't know (anything) about most of the cases until Wednesday.

example.name: knowledgeable-j: args 0, 2
example.text: I 'm fairly knowledgeable about how the culture works in that part of the world , as is many of the experts .
example.arg: about how the culture works in that part of the world
as is many of the experts

example.name: idk-v: both args
example.text: *PRO* Idk what I 'm going to do without you
example.arg: what I'm going to do without you

example.name: know vs. know about, compare with .02 examples
example.text: I know a lot about London. (I have read much about it.)

example.name: Know TO BE, rephrasable as We know the truth of your words, ignore arg2 for AMR.
example.text: We know [your words]-1 *-1 to be true.

example.name: Know TO BE, more weird syntax for PB, ignore arg2 for AMR
example.text: They know [the Cherokee Nation]-1 *-1 to be a sovereign state.

roleset.name: kennen; be familiar with, have experienced
roleset.note: KNOW-V NOTES: Split off from the original .01 roleset by Julia for unification.

KNOWN-J NOTES: Split off from the original .01 roleset by Julia for unification. Context may be needed to disambiguate senses .01 and .02 in some cases. The Little Prince example below may require knowledge that the Little Prince has visited this planet. This is a common distinction made in other languages such as German, French, Spanish, Italian, etc.

role.descr: what arg1 is known AS, or TO be, do, attribute

example.name: know-v: just transitive
example.text: I do not know him.

example.name: know vs. know about, compare with .01 examples
example.text: I know London well. (I've been there many times.)

example.name: know vs. know about, somewhat ambiguous
example.text: I knew a planet that was inhabited by a lazy man.
example.arg: a planet that was inhabited by a lazy man

example.name: known-j
example.text: Defendant is known to me and provided his name when I asked.

example.name: experience
example.text: I have known hunger.

example.name: known-as
example.text: Samuel Langhorne Clemens was known as Mark Twain.

example.name: known-for
example.text: Mark Twain was known for the Adventures of Huckleberry Finn.
example.arg: for the Adventures of Huckleberry Finn

example.name: poetic usage
example.text: Her love knew no bounds.

example.name: know-v: attribute
example.text: [These nations]-1 are known *trace*-1 as "little tigers"

example.name: know-v: infinitival attribute, contrast with sense 01
example.text: I have never known a lady to faint in the belfry.

example.name: know-v: marginal usage, don't let the FOR syntax confuse you!
example.text: Mary knows John for an idiot.

example.name: known-j
example.text: . China and India are both ancient countries with ancient cultures , and both have long histories and cultures ; the people of both nations are well known for being hard working , intelligent,and having a good natureed civilization , and have both been humiliated and invaded by foreign races .
example.arg: for being hard working , intelligent , and having a good natureed civilizatio

example.name: knowledgeable-j: all args
example.text: Within those two incidents of which one is not aware, we become knowledgeable of them as primary forces in life.
example.arg: within those two incidents of which one is not aware

roleset.name: have an ability, skill, or know-how
roleset.note: New sense added by Claire in AMR discussion March 2015.

example.name: skill as NP object
example.text: I know Latin.

example.name: skill as how complement
example.text: I know how to speak Latin.

example.name: with dances
example.text: I know (how to dance the) Macarena.

roleset.name: recognize, differentiate
roleset.note: New sense added by Claire in AMR discussion March 2015.

role.descr: knower, entity with ability to recognize/differentiate

example.name: with Manner
example.text: The dog new his master by his voice.

example.name: with others
example.text: The dog new his master's call from all the other voices.

example.name: with differentiated-from
example.text: She doesn't know one end of the car from the other.

example.name: recognize
example.text: They know a tasty meal when they eat one.

roleset.name: Biblical sense, to have sex with
roleset.note: New sense added by Claire in AMR discussion March 2015. Careful to distinguish from 02 sense.

example.name: A special kind of familiarity
example.text: Adam knew Eve.

roleset.name: discourse usage
roleset.note: New sense added by Claire in AMR discussion March 2015. Annotate sense for PB, drop from AMR.

example.name: Always arg0 only for PB, drop for AMR
example.text: John, you know, is an alcoholic.

example.name: President Bush quote
example.text: I just can't envision myself, you know, with a big straw hat and Hawaiian shirt, sitting on some beach.
